23.ara-name: كتاب الجهاد عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم

hadiths.text: Narrated Anas: "The Prophet (ﷺ) was the nicest person among the people, the most generous of the people, and the bravest among the people." He said: "The inhabitants of Al-Madinah became freightened one night upon hearing a loud noise." He said: "So the Prophet (ﷺ) met them upon an unsaddled horse belonging to Abu Talhah, with a sword hanging around his neck. He said: 'I found him to be (quick) like the sea.'" - meaning the horse. [Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih

chapter.ara-name: باب مَا جَاءَ فِي الْخُرُوجِ عِنْدَ الْفَزَعِ
chapter.eng-name: What Has Been Related About Going Out During The Time Of Fright
